  • 2 cups water

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 15 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1/2 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1/4 cup powdered sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract (for cream)
  • 4 oz semisweet chocolate, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons unsalted butter (for glaze)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
  3. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
  4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture until just combined.
  5. Drop tablespoon-sized balls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes until the edges are lightly golden.
  6. While the cookies cool, whip the heavy cream with powdered sugar and vanilla extract until stiff peaks form.
  7. Once the cookies are cooled, sandwich them with the whipped cream filling.
  8. For the glaze, melt the chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth. Drizzle over the cookies before serving.

item.description: This hearty crockpot beef stew is the ultimate comfort meal. Tender beef, soft veggies, and a savory broth simmer together for hours. Perfect for chilly evenings or meal prep! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 480min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761229889885 #Easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 480 minutes

â° Total Time: 495 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
  • 4 medium carrots, sliced
  • 4 medium potatoes, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped

  • 2 tbsp tomato paste
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 1 bay leaf

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 30 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 25 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 4 large eggs, separated
  • 1 cup granulated sugar, divided
  • 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, sifted
  • 1/3 cup cocoa powder, unsweetened (like Ghirardelli)
  • 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup heavy cream (use Organic Valley for best results)
  • 1/4 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Chocolate shavings, for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Line a 15x10-inch baking pan with parchment paper, letting some hang over the edges. This makes it easier to lift out later.
  2. In a mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks with half the sugar until pale and thick. This step is crucial for that fluffy texture.
  3. Sift the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt into the yolk mixture. Gently fold until just combined, being careful not to overmix.
  4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy, then gradually add the remaining sugar. Whip until stiff peaks form. Fold a third of the whites into the chocolate mixture, then gently fold in the remaining whites. You want to keep it light!
  5. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cake springs back when lightly pressed. It should look set but not dry.
  6. Once out of the oven, let it cool in the pan for about 5 minutes. Then, invert it onto a clean kitchen towel dusted with powdered sugar. Carefully peel off the parchment. Roll it up with the towel from the short side and let it cool completely.
